testcase.name: Scenario: Backup simple file with file backup command: /home/usr01/elastio/cli/e2e/features/linux/backup-restore.feature:27:9
testcase.system-out: Scenario Outline: Backup simple file with file backup command ✔ Given I create default ext4 filesystem with 1 GIB size ✔ And I create file with 10 MIB size and random fill strategy ✔ And I backup created file ✔ And I query recovery points ✔ Then I check progress report for base file back up ✔ When I restore backed up file ✔ Then I compare backed up and restored files ✔ When I update created file with following properties: | update_action | update_length | update_offset | | insert | 5 MIB | 3 MIB | ✔ And I backup created file ✔ And I query recovery points ✔ Then I check progress report for incremental file back up ✔ When I restore backed up file ✔ Then I compare backed up and restored files

testcase.name: Scenario: Backup filesystem: /home/usr01/elastio/cli/e2e/features/linux/backup-restore.feature:120:9
testcase.system-out: Scenario Outline: Backup filesystem ✔ Given I create default ext4 filesystem with 1 GIB size ✔ And I create file system tree with splitting 100 MIB between files, default tree depth and without sparse files ✔ When I backup created filesystem ✔ And I query recovery points ✔ Then I check progress report for filesystem back up ✔ When I restore backed up filesystem with no filter ✔ Then I compare backed up and restored filesystem ✔ When I update created file system tree ✔ And I backup created filesystem ✔ And I query recovery points ✔ Then I check progress report for filesystem back up ✔ When I restore backed up filesystem with no filter ✔ Then I compare backed up and restored filesystem ✔ When I create file system tree with splitting 50 MIB between files, default tree depth and without sparse files ✔ And I backup created filesystem ✔ And I query recovery points ✔ Then I check progress report for filesystem back up ✔ When I restore backed up filesystem with no filter ✔ Then I compare backed up and restored filesystem
